title.narrative: DATA, STATISTICS AND ANALYSIS

description.narrative: Sectoral ministries and other State entities strengthen systems for collecting, analysing and disseminating disaggregated data, taking into account the Sustainable Development Goals and other priorities of public policies on children, women and families., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, Turkmenistan makes considerable progress in implementing the Convention on the Rights of the Child, Sustainable Development Goals, Sendai Framework and other international and national commitments for children, with the maximum, effective and efficient use of available resources

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Data analysis, including situation analysis and update

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sectoral ministries and other State entities strengthen systems for collecting, analysing and disseminating disaggregated data,taking into account the Sustainable Development Goals and other priorities of public policies on children, women and families.

description.narrative: Increased national capacity in generating and analyzing the data on the most vulnerable and ongoing development of the Civil Registration and Vital Statistics Register, resulted in the availability of new data on the impact of the pandemic on households and on the situation of children with disabilities in 2021, and further strengthened systems and capacities for SDG monitoring going forward. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State, Text

baseline.value: No - partially (A Law on Civil Registration has been adopted in 2020, that envisions creation of the unique identification number by 2022. Civil registration in Turkmenistan characterized as continuous, permanent, compulsory and universal. Other important

actual.value: 2021:YES (Road Map on CRVS Register is developed and Legislation review on birth and death registration is completed)

title.narrative: Extent to which data is available on vulnerable groups of children., Text

baseline.value: Partially available the new module on child functioning has been added to MICS6 and findings and quality assessment are available. Turkmenistan used the ECD index data from MICS to report on the SDG indicator 4.2.1. in its 2019 Voluntary National Review

target.value: 2025:Fully available – data on all the five dimensions are available and updated through the 2024 MICS and/or census, administrative data and government reports.

actual.value: 2021:Partially - Survey on PwDs, LFS with Covid module

title.narrative: Extent to which data is available on vulnerable groups of children., Text

baseline.value: Partially available the new module on child functioning has been added to MICS6 and findings and quality assessment are available. Turkmenistan used the ECD index data from MICS to report on the SDG indicator 4.2.1. in its 2019 Voluntary National Review

target.value: 2025:Fully available – data on all the five dimensions are available and updated through the 2024 MICS and/or census, administrative data and government reports.

actual.value: 2021:Partially - Survey on PwDs, LFS with Covid module

title.narrative: Disaggregated data from the new round of MICS is available (yes/no), Text

target.value: 2025:Yes (MICS 7) If there are no major issues with data quality, funding and Government ownership, the next MICS is planned to take place in 2023/24.

actual.value: 2021:Yes, data is available and used for COVID impact snapshot and UN CCA
